summary: An "oral question" is a procedural tool utilized within the European Parliament, allowing Members of Parliament (MEPs) to seek immediate clarification or information from the European Commission or the Council. This mechanism fosters accountability and transparency in the EU's legislative process, enabling MEPs to address pressing issues in real-time. Oral questions are typically posed during plenary sessions, facilitating direct dialogue and engagement on critical regulatory matters. The responses provided can influence subsequent legislative actions and policy formulation, underscoring the importance of this instrument in the democratic functioning of the EU's institutional framework.
